texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: author: Major Hayden date: '2023-04-19' 1Password has a handy quick access launcher and you can bring it on screen for fast access to passwords and two factor codes in Sway. 🔐 tags:
texts.text: author: Major Hayden date: '2023-04-19' 1Password has a handy quick access launcher and you can bring it on screen for fast access to passwords and two factor codes in Sway. 🔐 tags:

texts.text: sway

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: 1Password  remains a core part of my authentication workflow for password, two factor authentication, and even ssh keys. It uses Linux system authentication to authenticate access from various command line tools and that's quite helpful for automation.
texts.text: 1Password  remains a core part of my authentication workflow for password, two factor authentication, and even ssh keys. It uses Linux system authentication to authenticate access from various command line tools and that's quite helpful for automation.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Sometimes I need a quick copy of a particular password or two factor code while I'm in another application.  That's where 1Password's  quick access  menu comes in very handy.
texts.text: Sometimes I need a quick copy of a particular password or two factor code while I'm in another application.  That's where 1Password's  quick access  menu comes in very handy.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: It creates a pop-up in the middle of the screen that you can use immediately to search your vault. Once you find what you need, you can press various hot keys to get the right data into your clipboard.
texts.text: It creates a pop-up in the middle of the screen that you can use immediately to search your vault. Once you find what you need, you can press various hot keys to get the right data into your clipboard.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Press the right arrow key once the right credential is highlighted and you'll get instructions on which key combinations to press:
texts.text: Press the right arrow key once the right credential is highlighted and you'll get instructions on which key combinations to press:

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: ctrl-c

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ctrl-shift-c
texts.text: ctrl-shift-c

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ctrl-alt-c
texts.text: ctrl-alt-c

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: In most window managers, 1Password handles the keybinding for launching the quick access menu, which is
texts.text: In most window managers, 1Password handles the keybinding for launching the quick access menu, which is

texts.label: code
texts.orig: ctrl-shift-space
texts.text: ctrl-shift-space

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: by default. You can probably guess by the title of this post that it doesn't work out of the box with Sway. 😉
texts.text: by default. You can probably guess by the title of this post that it doesn't work out of the box with Sway. 😉

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Integrating with Sway
texts.text: Integrating with Sway

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Start by adding a keybinding for the quick access menu. I added mine in
texts.text: Start by adding a keybinding for the quick access menu. I added mine in

texts.label: code
texts.orig: ~/.config/sway/config.d/launcher.conf
texts.text: ~/.config/sway/config.d/launcher.conf

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# Start 1Password Quick Access
bindsym Control+Shift+Space exec /usr/bin/1password --quick-access
texts.text:
# Start 1Password Quick Access
bindsym Control+Shift+Space exec /usr/bin/1password --quick-access

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Save the file and reload Sway's configuration with
texts.text: Save the file and reload Sway's configuration with

texts.label: code
texts.orig: mod+shift+c
texts.text: mod+shift+c

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: (mod is usually your Windows key unless you changed it) . Now press
texts.text: (mod is usually your Windows key unless you changed it) . Now press

texts.label: code
texts.orig: ctrl-shift-space
texts.text: ctrl-shift-space

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: and the quick access menu should appear!
texts.text: and the quick access menu should appear!
